verses.verse: For the director.[b] “Upon the gittith.” A psalm of the sons of Korah.
How lovely is your dwelling place, O LORD of hosts.[c]
My soul yearns and is filled with longing for the courts of the LORD. My heart and my flesh cry out for the living God.
Just as the sparrow searches for a home and the swallow builds a nest for herself where she may place her young, so do I seek your altars,[d] O LORD of hosts, my King and my God.
Blessed[e] are those who dwell in your house; they offer continuous praise to you. Selah
Blessed are those who find strength in you, who set their hearts upon your ways.[f]
As they pass through the Valley of Baca, they turn it into a region of springs, and the early rain covers it with pools.[g]
[h]They move forward with increasing strength as they behold the God of gods in Zion.
O LORD of hosts, hear my prayer; listen to my pleas, O God of Jacob. Selah
O God, look upon our shield[i] behold the face of your anointed one.
It is better to spend one day in your courts than a thousand elsewhere. I would rather be a doorkeeper[j] in God’s house than dwell inside the tents of the wicked.
The LORD God serves as our sun[k] and our shield; the LORD showers us with grace and glory. He does not withhold any good thing from those who walk in integrity.
